commenter_b: Katie price is entitled to exactly the same as everyone else she is a British citizen who pays her taxes so she and her children are entitled to use the Nhs. commenter_a: The benefit system isn't struggling & costs being cut because of Katie Price, it's struggling because of the generation of freeloaders who see Benefits as a career choice, people who can work & pay taxes but don't; If everyone in this country that can work had the right work ethic we wouldn't be in half the mess we are. I was always brought up benefits are for those who need it for clothes, warmth, food, the essentials - including specialist care for the disabled, people nowadays have full sky packages watched on 50" tvs, have a social life and go abroad for holidays all from benefits, where's the incentive then to get off their backsides and go to work. Whilst I'm not her biggest fan Katie price pays much more than her fair share in tax, she's a grafter & a worker, her son deserves his benefit rights in return
post_message: "This is exactly why universal benefits matter. Defend the right of mothers of disabled children, such as Price, to get help, and it reinforces the rights of everyone else.
